intro: Psephellus sibiricus, commonly known as Siberian sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to harsh, arctic or alpine environments. Psephellus sibiricus is often found in tundra and steppe regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
